A storyboard is a visual representation of the elements of a video or film, including the shots, the transitions between shots, and any dialogue or narration. It's typically used to plan out the structure and flow of a video or film before it is filmed or produced.

To build a storyboard around one of the show concepts listed above, you will need to determine the key elements of your show and how they will be presented to your audience. Here are some steps you can follow to build a storyboard:

1. Determine the purpose of your show: What is the main goal of your show? What do you want to achieve with your vlog?
2. Identify your target audience: Who is your show for? Who do you want to reach with your vlog?
3. Choose your show concept: Based on your purpose and target audience, choose a show concept that will be most effective at achieving your goals and engaging your audience.
4. Outline the structure of your show: Determine the key elements of your show and how they will be presented to your audience. For example, if you're doing an interview show, you might have an introduction, an interview segment, and a closing.
5. Create a shot list: Identify the shots you will need to capture to tell your story effectively. For example, you might need shots of your studio, shots of you working on music, or shots of you interacting with your audience.
